alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Warning issued April 29 at 12:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the San Miguel County Sheriff`s Department. The southern end of the Hermits Peak/Calf Canyon fires are spreading rapidly east and southeast through the Gallinas River corridor. This is a dangerous and life threatening fire situation. The head of the fire could potentially be 1 mile west of the junction of Highway 65 and Forest Road 263 at 5 pm. The fire could potentially spread to Gallinas by 7 pm and then spread to 1 mile east of Gallinas by 9 pm. Big Pine, Porvenir Canyon, Canovas Canyon, El Porvenir, Gallinas, Lower Canyon Road and Trout Springs are in GO mandatory evacuation status. Leave these areas now. Heavy smoke is impacting the area and will continue to expand in coverage toward the east through the Gallinas River corridor and along County Road A27.
